definition: to lower/to decrease/to reduce/to subtract/to diminish

sentences.english: For colleagues in the East, the anguish is extra presumable to come via a pay cut.
sentences.chinese: 而對於東方“同仁“們來說，可能只是減薪而已。

sentences.english: Q27. Do you think your company will have redundancy or wage reduction plan in the coming 6 months?
sentences.chinese: 你認爲你嘅公司系嚟緊呢半年，會唔會裁員或者減薪？

sentences.english: They had a hot discussion over the pay cut of civil servants.
sentences.chinese: 他們爲公務員減薪問題而吵得臉紅耳熱。

sentences.english: And some big salary cuts might skew overall numbers.
sentences.chinese: 而一些大規模的減薪可能扭曲整體數字。

sentences.english: That was after he took a government-mandated 10% pay cut.
sentences.chinese: 這還是政府強制減薪10%後的數額。

sentences.english: Is this a mandatory or voluntary pay cut?
sentences.chinese: 這次減薪是強制的還是自願的？

sentences.english: A source with the State Grid confirmed the company does have a plan to reduce wage.
sentences.chinese: 記者向國家電網相關人士證實，減薪確有此事。

sentences.english: Many Bush appointees are believed to be taking pay cuts just to stay employed.
sentences.chinese: 許多布什政府任命的人都認爲減薪乃保全工作之舉。

definition: (computing) transcoding/to convert (from one encoding to another)
private business/opposite: state-owned enterprise 國有企業|国有企业[guo2 you3 qi3 ye4]
